channel.title: Business News
channel.description: Latest headlines for business news around the world.

item.title: Shonda Rhimes is among the creators unhappy with Netflix's mid-video ads, sources say
item.description: Shonda Rhimes is among a group of creators who have expressed displeasure with Netflix's midroll advertising, sources say.

item.title: Retailers have a new holiday headache — people are spending their money on travel
item.description: The peak shopping season will test spending priorities of consumers who are facing high inflation.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs to acquire cannabis businesses for up to $185M
item.description: Hip-hop mogul and businessman Sean "Diddy" Combs is venturing into the world of cannabis.

item.title: DraftKings shares tumble after monthly users fall short of estimates
item.description: DraftKings stock fell as much as 26% on Friday despite the sports betting company posting higher-than-expected revenue for its third-quarter earnings report.

item.title: Rocket Lab launches mission, but calls off attempt to catch Electron booster with a helicopter
item.description: Space company Rocket Lab made another attempt at catching one of its Electron boosters with a helicopter, as it pursues reusability.

item.title: Climate activists swarm private jets at Amsterdam airport to protest pollution
item.description: Hundreds of climate activists swarmed a private jet section of Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport on Saturday as part of a day of demonstrations in and around the airport.

item.title: Elite New York restauranteur Will Guidara on why luxury spending isn't the key to making people happy
item.description: Will Guidara, former owner of Eleven Madison Park, learned a valuable lesson about spending and satisfaction with the help of his wife and a Cartier necklace.

item.title: How phone scammers tricked Americans out of tens of billions of dollars in 2022
item.description: Despite the rise of sophisticated crypto frauds and ransomware plots, scams that start with phone calls continue to trick Americans out of tens of billions of dollars each year.

item.title: 5 key personal finance issues this midterm election season — and what they mean for your wallet
item.description: Here are some of the most pressing personal finance issues for the midterm elections — and how Tuesday's results may affect your wallet.

item.title: Why hearing aids are so expensive
item.description: The global hearing aid market was valued at over $10 billion in 2021. Critics say the five largest manufacturers, who control 90% of the market, keep prices up.

item.title: Cramer's lightning round: Cano Health is a buy
item.description: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer rings the lightning round bell, which means he's giving his answers to callers' stock questions at rapid speed.

item.title: Jim Cramer's week ahead: Get ready to 'pounce' when the market is oversold
item.description: Jim Cramer also went over next week's slate of earnings from companies including Disney, AMC, BioNTech and more

item.title: Federal prosecutors charge ex-CEOs of MoviePass, parent company in alleged fraud scheme
item.description: The former CEOs of MoviePass and its parent company have been charged with fraud, according to the Justice Department.

item.title: What it feels like to visit a fusion company lab on a day when wildfire smoke cloaks the horizon
item.description: I visited Helion Energy in Everett, Washington, on October 20th when wildfire smoke was making it dangerous to be outside. Here's what that felt like.

item.title: United Airlines opens a new grab-and-go lounge in Denver for time-crunched travelers
item.description: United's new lounge offers customers grab-and-go food options and made-to-order coffee drinks.

item.title: U.S. faces highest flu hospitalization rate in a decade with young kids and seniors most at risk
item.description: Seniors and children younger than age 5 are most at risk right now, public health official said.

item.title: Carvana stock posts worst day ever as outlook darkens for used vehicle market
item.description: Shares of Carvana posted their worst day on record Friday after the company missed Wall Street's top- and bottom-line expectations for the third quarter.

item.title: House hunting this weekend? There's more out there now
item.description: After more than two years of an historically lean housing market, listings are now starting to rise, and swiftly.

item.title: Puma CEO Bjorn Gulden in talks to succeed Kasper Rorsted as chief of Adidas
item.description: Adidas has faced a recent public relations crisis in its dealings with Ye, formerly known as Kanye West.

item.title: Starbucks U.S. sales climb as customers spend more on pricey drinks
item.description: Shares of Starbucks have fallen nearly 28% this year, dragging its market value down to $97.11 billion.

item.title: Warner Bros Discovery reports underwhelming revenue, says new streaming service coming earlier
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery reported third quarter earnings and said its merged HBO Max-Discovery+ streaming service will come in spring instead of summer.

item.title: Virgin Galactic CEO outlines remaining steps before commercial spaceflight service begins next year
item.description: Virgin Galactic CEO Michael Colglazier outlined the remaining steps before the space tourism company aims to launch its long-delayed service next year.

item.title: Pilot contract negotiations with airlines turn sour
item.description: Airlines are facing the dual challenge of combatting a shortage of pilots while keeping a lid on costs.

item.title: Jeff Bezos is interested in bidding for the NFL's Washington Commanders, reports say
item.description: Jeff Bezos is interested in bidding for the NFL's Washington Commanders, possibly alongside Jay-Z, reports say.

item.title: Inflation to dampen holiday spending, retail trade group forecasts
item.description: The National Retail Federation said it expects holiday sales to rise between 6% and 8% from last year — a decline when factoring in the effect of inflation.

item.title: Carvana tumbles after posting declines in nearly every aspect of the car reseller's business
item.description: Shares of Carvana fell in extended trading Thursday after the online used car retailer missed Wall Street's top- and bottom-line expectations for the third quarter.

item.title: Jeep-maker Stellantis expects raw material inflation to ease next year
item.description: The spiking costs of raw materials have been largely offset by record pricing of new vehicles. But as price increases slow, costs have yet to follow.

item.title: Outgoing Charter CEO Tom Rutledge says in an exclusive CNBC interview that there's 'pain to come' as linear TV gives way to streaming
item.description: Charter CEO Tom Rutledge gives his exit interview in a CNBC exclusive as he prepares for retirement.

item.title: NBA Commissioner Adam Silver speaks out against Kyrie Irving's antisemitic post
item.description: In a statement, Silver called the decision to post the video "reckless" and said he will be meeting with Irving in person next week to discuss the situation.

item.title: CNBC cancels 'The News with Shepard Smith' to refocus on business news
item.description: CNBC has canceled "The News with Shepard Smith" after two years as CNBC's 7 p.m. ET general news program.
